cards.title: Form Example
cards.code:
<script>
  let username = $state("");
  let password = $state("");

  function handleSubmit(event) {
    event.preventDefault();
    alert(`Logging in with ${username} and ${password}`);
  }
</script>

<form onsubmit={handleSubmit}>
  <input type="text" placeholder="Username" bind:value={username} />
  <input type="password" placeholder="Password" bind:value={password} />
  <input type="submit" value="Login" />
</form>

<script>
  import { onMount } from 'svelte';

  onMount(() => {
    console.log('Component mounted');
  });
</script>

cards.title: beforeUpdate

  import { beforeUpdate } from 'svelte';

    console.log('Before component updates');
  });
</script>

cards.title: afterUpdate
cards.code:
<script>
  import { afterUpdate } from 'svelte';

  afterUpdate(() => {
    console.log('After component updates');
  });
</script>

cards.title: onDestroy
cards.code:
<script>
  import { onDestroy } from 'svelte';

  onDestroy(() => {
    console.log('Component destroyed');
  });
</script>

cards.title: onDestroy
cards.body:
Note: Svelte lifecycle functions are similar to React Hooks, but they are imported individually and used directly in the
`<script>` block.
